ai-ud2.4:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud2.4:1.3_0: Now at that time the Buddha was honored, respected, revered, venerated, and esteemed. And he received robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
ai-ud2.4:1.4_0: And the mendicant Saṅgha was also honored, respected, revered, venerated, and esteemed. And they received robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
ai-ud2.4:1.5_0: But the wanderers who followed other paths were not honored, respected, esteemed, revered, and venerated. And they didn’t receive robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
ai-ud2.4:1.6_0: Then those wanderers who followed other paths, unable to bear the esteem of the mendicant Sangha, abused, attacked, harassed, and troubled the mendicants in the village and the wilderness.
ai-ud2.4:2.1_0: Then many monks went to the Fortunate One,
ai-ud2.4:2.1_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-ud2.4:2.4_0: And the mendicant Saṅgha was also honored, respected, revered, venerated, and esteemed. And they received robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
ai-ud2.4:2.5_0: But the wanderers who followed other paths were not honored, respected, esteemed, revered, and venerated. And they didn’t receive robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
ai-ud2.4:2.6_0: Then those wanderers who followed other paths, unable to bear the esteem of the mendicant Sangha, abused, attacked, harassed, and troubled the mendicants in the village and the wilderness.”
ai-ud2.4:3.1_0: Then, knowing the significance of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud2.4:4.1_0: “Affected by pleasure and pain in the village or wilderness,
ai-ud2.4:4.2_0: regard it not as self or other.
ai-ud2.4:4.4_0: how would contacts strike one free of attachment?”
